business.headline: Tariff war may benefit India despite short-term shocks: Mercedes-Benz India CEOMercedes-Benz India CEO Santosh Iyer stated that India may benefit from the ongoing global tariff war in the long term despite short-term challenges. He highlights the potential for increased trade and reduced barriers as a positive outcome for India.

Why is Apple in a race against time to fly iPhones back to the US?Apple's long-term goal is to reduce its dependence on Chinese factories and shift more production to other countries, with India playing a big part in that plan.  However, it relies heavily on a network of suppliers and trained workers that only exists at the required scale in parts of Asia.

RBI launches WhatsApp Channel: Here's how to access it via QR codeThe RBI said that the goal of the WhatsApp channel is to provide verified and timely information about banking, digital safety, and other important topics directly to users.

Pentagon cuts $5.1 billion contracts with Accenture, Deloitte: Wasteful spendingThe contracts appeared to be wide-ranging cuts to consulting services for the Navy, the Air Force, the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) and the Defense Health Agency.

Wall Street bounces back after wild week fueled by tariff warAll three major US indexes ended the session sharply higher after assurances from Boston Federal Reserve President Susan Collins that the Fed is prepared to keep financial markets functioning should the need arise.

India pushing for trade deals with US, EU with high urgency: JaishankarOn Wednesday, Trump announced a 90-day pause on his sweeping tariffs on all countries, except China as countries around the world wilted under the impact of the seismic action.

How Trump tariffs could make iPhones, cars, and clothes costlier in the USTrump's latest plan includes a massive 145% tax on goods coming from China. Experts say this could end the long run of cheap, imported goods that Americans have enjoyed for decades.
Sensex ends 1,300 points higher, Nifty above 22,500; Tata Steel up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,310.11 points to close at 75,157.26, while the NSE Nifty50 added 429.40 points to end at 22,828.55.

Mutual fund SIP vs PPF: What Rs 1 lakh a year can earn in 15 yearsPPF is a government scheme with a current interest rate of around 7.1% per annum. On the other hand, SIPs typically offer higher interest when invested over the long term, especially in equity mutual funds. But they carry some risk, as returns depend on the market.

Explained: Why Muthoot Finance shares fell over 8% todayMuthoot Finance stock price: Muthoot Finance, one of India's largest gold loan companies, has seen its share price decline by 14% in the past five trading sessions. The stock is also down 7% over the past month.

Mutual fund inflows hit in March. Trump tariffs to blame?The largest outflows were seen in debt mutual funds, where investors pulled out Rs 2.02 lakh crore, possibly due to end-of-year financial needs by institutions and ongoing global uncertainty.

Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath's money advice: 'No shortcuts to getting rich'Nithin Kamath shared a video with a powerful message—earning more doesn't mean you're saving more. In fact, higher income often leads to more spending on gadgets, clothes, dining out, or things meant just to impress others.

entertainment.headline: Babil Khan reacts to trolling over old apology video: Some memes hurt meActor Babil Khan broke his silence on the trolling that he was subjected to after hi repeated apologies for mistakenly photobombing a woman at an event.
I do feel bad: Taarak Mehta creator Asit Modi breaks silence on controversies'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' creator Asit Modi responded to allegations raised by former actors of the show.

Kylie Jenner, Timothee Chalamet kiss and cuddle at Coachella 2025. WatchKylie Jenner and Timothee Chalamet were clicked together on the second day of Coachella on April 12. The two indulged in PDA at the event.

Mother-to-be Gauahar Khan dazzles on ramp, flaunts baby bump. WatchGauhara Khan, who is expecting her second child with husband Zaid Darbar, stole the attention with her stunning ramp walk. The actor flaunted her baby bump in a viral video.

Why Adolescence actor Owen Cooper hasn't watched his hit Netflix showActor Owen Cooper recently reacted to the screening of the Netflix series Adolescence in schools. The actor called it his 'worst nightmare'

Actor Mouni Roy breaks silence on plastic surgery rumours and brutal trollingActor Mouni Roy has been trolled after reports of her getting plastic surgery surfaced. She broke her silence on the relentless trolling at a recent event.

Hrithik Roshan's US event organisers reject mismanagement claims after complaintsHrithik Roshan's fans were upset after they were denied photos and autographs at the actor's US event. However, the organisers have now reacted to the claims going viral.

Jaat box office Day 3: Sunny Deol's film rakes in Rs 25 crore in IndiaSunny Deol's recently released film 'Jaat' earned over Rs 25 crore in India in three days. The film has been receiving mixed reviews from all quarters.
Salman Khan's adorable gesture for young fan wins the internet. WatchSalman Khan's adorable gesture for a young fan has gone viral. In the clip, the actor obliged the little one with a picture.

Sunny Deol's weighs in on Salman Khan's statement about actors' insecuritySunny Deol, while promoting his film 'Jaat' in the national capital, discussed the issue of actor insecurity, a topic recently highlighted by Salman Khan. Deol expressed that insecurity is a natural part of an actor's growth journey and can serve as a stepping stone rather than a hindrance.

First watch movie then..: Phule actor Pratik Gandhi's appeal as row delays releasePratik Gandhi's upcoming film, 'Phule', has been postponed. In an interview, the actor urged the Brahmin community not to form opinions about the film based solely on the trailer.

Aamir Khan, girlfriend Gauri Spratt hold hands in first public appearance in ChinaAamir Khan and his girlfriend Gauri Spratt made their first public appearance at an event in China. They held hands as they posed with Chinese actors Shen Teng and Ma Li.

Good Bad Ugly box office Day 3: Ajith Kumar's film grosses Rs 100 crore worldwideAjith Kumar's recently released film 'Good Bad Ugly' surpassed Rs 100 crore worldwide. The film saw an increase in numbers on Saturday.

Kareena Kapoor brings back Chammak Challo magic at Dubai event. WatchKareena Kapoor delighted fans with her moves on her song 'Chammak Chalo' at an event in Dubai. A video of the actor grooving to the hit track has emerged online.

Tamil actor Sri posts explicit content on Instagram, worried fans call for helpTamil actor Sri alias Shriram Natarajan recently posted explicit videos on Instagram. Worried fans were shocked to see his transformation and called for help.

Singer Sonu Kakkar says 'no longer sister to Neha and Tony', deletes post laterSinger Sonu Kakkar, in an X post, wrote that she was cutting ties with her siblings, Neha Kakkar and Tony Kakkar. However, she deleted the post later.

The Immortal Devdas: When pain becomes poetry in black and whiteBimal Roy's 'Devdas', a 1955 classic, is a poignant masterpiece of Indian cinema. Dilip Kumar's portrayal of a doomed lover remains unmatched.

Pawan Kalyan, son Mark and family back in Hyderabad after Singapore school fireAndhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister and Telugu actor Pawan Kalyan returned to Hyderabad with his son, Mark Shankar, and family. Mark was injured in the Singapore school fire incident last week.

Priyanka-Nick's daughter to enter showbiz at young age? Singer reactsNick Jonas recently opened up about his daughter, Malti Marie, entering showbiz. The singer revealed that he has had this conversation with his wife-actor, Priyanka Chopra.

general news.headline: Girl, 5, murdered after attempted rape in Karnataka, accused killed in encounterThe Karnataka Police killed a Patna man accused of attempting to rape a minor girl in an encounter. The accused, Ritesh, tried to flee after attacking officers, prompting police to open fire. He later succumbed to his injuries in the hospital.

Who is Nikita Casap? US teen charged with killing parents, plotting to kill TrumpAuthorities said that Nikita Casap, 17, killed his parents in February in a plan to finance the assassination of US President Donald Trump and overthrow his government.

Cyber attack on IAF aircraft involved in Myanmar quake relief op: Defence sourcesA GPS-spoofing attack targetted an Indian Air Force's C-130J aircraft while it was flying over Myanmar during the Operation Brahma relief mission in the earthquake-hit Southeast Asian country, defence sources told India Today TV.

Karun Nair's 89 in vain as Mumbai end Delhi's dream runDC vs MI, IPL 2025: Karun Nair scored 89 runs off 40 balls, but his knock went in vain as the Delhi Capitals lost to the Mumbai Indians by 12 runs on Sunday at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi.

How India can weather trade tsunami in era of Trump tariffsMontek Singh Ahluwalia's take on strengthening trade ties with the world beyond United States on the basis of multilateral rules while dealing bilaterally with America

Man thrashes wife with screwdriver for giving birth to daughter in UttarakhandA woman was brutally assaulted by her husband in Uttarakhand for giving birth to a girl, despite prior dowry harassment and threats.

Akash Anand seeks re-entry into BSP, Mayawati agrees to give him a chanceAkash Anand, who was sacked by BSP chief Mayawati in a major reshuffle, has sought an apology from her aunt and asked her to take him back into the party. In response, Mayawati said she would give him a chance but wouldn't name a political sucessor.

Leave now, self-deport: US's 30-day warning to foreign nationals for registrationThe US Department of Homeland Security (DHS) stressed the need for self-deportation and asked foreign nationals to register themselves with the government within 30 days or face fines or imprisonment.

I cried to a chatbot, and it actually helpedFrom breakups and loneliness to toxic bosses and passive-aggressive coworkers, people are turning to AI chatbot, ChatGPT, for life advice. Some are using it as a counsellor, and others for guidance, or just to feel heard. Here's what users, therapists and ChatGPT itself have to say about the phenomenon.

Tamil Nadu Governor asks students to chant Jai Shri Ram, sparks rowTamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi courted controversy after he made the students of an engineering college in Madurai chant Jai Shri Ram, prompting the DMK and Congress to allege that he was promoting RSS ideology.

'Except Israel' inscription back on Bangladesh passports as Gaza strikes intensifyBangladesh has reinstated the "except Israel" travel restriction on passports amid rising public outrage over Israeli attacks on Gaza.

DRDO tests laser-based weapon system, destroys drones in secondsThe laser-based weapons system engaged fixed-wing drones at long ranges, thwarted multiple drone attacks, and destroyed enemy surveillance sensors and antennae.

First watch movie then..: Phule actor Pratik Gandhi's appeal as row delays releasePratik Gandhi's upcoming film, 'Phule', has been postponed. In an interview, the actor urged the Brahmin community not to form opinions about the film based solely on the trailer.

Murshidabad residents recount violence: 'Our water poisoned, homes set on fire'West Bengal's Murshidabad district remains tense after violent protests erupted over the Waqf Act following Friday prayers, resulting in three confirmed deaths.

ICC to support displaced Afghanistan women cricketers, Jay Shah reveals detailsThe ICC has partnered with the BCCI, CA, and ECB to support displaced Afghanistan women cricketers, providing them with financial assistance, advanced coaching, and mentorship.

India flying and how: Air passenger traffic set for  80% jump in 5 yearsThe magnitude of the projected expansion indicates how infrastructure for airports, runways and corridors linking big and small cities will need to keep pace

A butcher and a traitor: The many ironies of Jallianwala Bagh massacreThe Jallianwala Bagh massacre of April 13, 1919, was orchestrated by Brigadier General Reginald Dyer, known as the 'Butcher of Amritsar', and possibly aided by Hans Raj, an Indian associate suspected of betraying his own people by setting the stage for the tragedy.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Bengal anti-Waqf protests: 3 killed, 150 arrested; BJP claims Hindus fleeing homesSeveral people were seen fleeing West Bengal's Murshidabad by boat, attempting to cross the river into neighbouring Malda in search of safety as violent protests against the Waqf Act continued even on Sunday.

Calm Virat Kohli, fiery Phil Salt seal RCB's 4th away win vs timid RRIPL 2025, RR vs RCB: Virat Kohli's smart pacing and Phil Salt's explosive start helpedirat Kohli's smart pacing and Phil Salt's explosive start helped RCB chase a 174-run target in 17.3 overs. RCB are four out of four in away games this season.

Aamir Khan, girlfriend Gauri Spratt hold hands in first public appearance in ChinaAamir Khan and his girlfriend Gauri Spratt made their first public appearance at an event in China. They held hands as they posed with Chinese actors Shen Teng and Ma Li.
'Decapitated' US woman's head re-attached to body after 37 surgeriesMegan King had an accident in 2005 during a football game when she was just 16. Her skull got "internally" detached from the spine.

Electronics no more exempt in trade war? Special US tariffs coming soonUS Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick announced that smartphones, computers, and other electronic items, and semiconductors will be a part of separate tariffs that will be imposed in a month or two.

Atishi alleges Rekha Gupta's husband running Delhi government, BJP hits backThe allegations, made via a post on social media, were accompanied by a photo that Atishi claimed showed Manish Gupta, Rekha Gupta's husband, presiding over a meeting with senior officials from departments including MCD, DJB, PWD, and DUSIB.

sports.headline: Karun Nair took us by surprise: Hardik admits DC batter put pressure on MIIPL 2025, DC vs MI: Hardik Pandya said that Karun Nair made life difficult for the Mumbai Indians bowlers in Sunday's clash at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. Nair made 89 off 40 before Mitchell Santner dismissed him.

Watch: Axar Patel's hilarious take on DC's 12-run loss vs MI: 'Mumbai ke pass'Delhi Capitals' (DC) captain Axar Patel gave a hilarious answer to Murali Kartik's question following his team's 12-run loss against Mumbai Indians (MI) at Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi.

RR had no option but to release players: Batting coach Vikram RathoreIPL 2025, RR vs RCB: Rajasthan Royals batting coach Viram Rathore explained how it was only natural for the side to let players go ahead of the 2025 mega auction due to team management, and backed the side's current squad to stage a turnaround this season.

Rohit Sharma teases Karun Nair after DC star's heated faceoff vs BumrahIPL 2025: Karun Nair's fiery fifty came with flair and fire as he collided with Jasprit Bumrah during a high-voltage DC vs MI clash, triggering tense exchanges and a classic Rohit Sharma smirk.

Karun Nair's 89 in vain as Mumbai end Delhi's dream runDC vs MI, IPL 2025: Karun Nair scored 89 runs off 40 balls, but his knock went in vain as the Delhi Capitals lost to the Mumbai Indians by 12 runs on Sunday at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi.

Watch: Kohli takes evasive action as fan comes running towards him in JaipurRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) star Virat Kohli was seen taking evasive action as a fan came running towards him after their win over Rajasthan Royals (RR) in Match 29 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

DC vs MI: Karun Nair smashes Jasprit Bumrah, hits IPL fifty after 7 yearsIPL 2025: Karun Nair marked his IPL comeback with a blistering fifty against MI, showing glimpses of his domestic dominance and silencing critics with a sensational assault on Jasprit Bumrah and Mumbai's pace attack.

RR can win all their remaining matches: Batting coach after RCB lossIPL 2025: Despite a tough start to IPL 2025, Rajasthan Royals batting coach Vikram Rathore believes the squad has the firepower to bounce back and keep their playoff hopes alive by winning their remaining fixtures. RR suffered their fourth loss of the season after going down by 9 wickets to RCB.

Stephen Fleming on CSK's six-hitting woes: Cricket isn't a baseball competitionIPL 2025, LSG vs CSK: In the pre-match press conference, Chennai Super Kings' head coach Stephen Fleming said that cricket isn't a baseball competition and there is still an importance of craft and traditional stroke-making.

IPL 2025: Why umpires checked the bat size of Hardik Pandya?The umpires were seen checking the bat size of Mumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya during Match 29 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) against Delhi Capitals (DC).

Sourav Ganguly re-appointed as ICC men's cricket committee chairpersonICC announced the reappointment of Sourav Ganguly as Men's Cricket Committee chair, reinforcing their trust in his leadership as he continues to guide the global development and regulation of the sport. The rest of the panel include the likes of VVS Laxman and even Temba Bavuma.

RR suffered their fourth loss of the season after going down by 9 wickets to RCB.

IPL 2025: Why umpires checked the bat size of Hardik Pandya?The umpires were seen checking the bat size of Mumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya during Match 29 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) against Delhi Capitals (DC).

Sourav Ganguly re-appointed as ICC men's cricket committee chairpersonICC announced the reappointment of Sourav Ganguly as Men's Cricket Committee chair, reinforcing their trust in his leadership as he continues to guide the global development and regulation of the sport. The rest of the panel include the likes of VVS Laxman and even Temba Bavuma.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
